subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: listening to posts

full_text:

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Thats great I'll have to check it out more in the morning

itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...> wrote:          Hi Rees. I'm at http://www.ITCdeadpeople.com

It's a super simple site. Just five pages. But page one has a link to some of my EVP which I 
posted on putfile. And page two has several links: one for instructions on the water video 
ITC technique, one to a Maury segment on youtube where some of my material was used 
(thanks for posting that, Debbie!), and a couple collages of the crystal images.

I hope you like it. 

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@...> wrote:
>
> Margaret, 
> 
> What is you sites address? Just wanting to check it out
> 
> Rees
> 
> itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...> wrote:
> Hi Misty. I was surprised at how much smaller my files became when I changed 
my 
> settings in Audacity to 16-bit MONO with an 11025Hz sample rate. I figure this is voice 
> we are recording, not the symphony. And in my case, I'm not doing any kind of 
frequency 
> analysis, or anything else that requires super high quality files. Files, in almost all cases, 
> really do not need to be 32-bit stereo with a 44100Hz sample rate. But I know how 
hard 
> it can be to convince some people of this.
> 
> I do save my individual raw files on my drive in WAV format. But if I'm going to post, I 
> create an MP3. Even my WAV files are small though. Just took a look, and with my 
> settings, a short WAV file runs about 88kb. Converted to MP3 it becomes just 16kb. I 
> have one that is 248kb in the raw, but after editing out unrelated content and exporting 
to 
> MP3, it was just 24kb. 
> 
> If people would just record with the lower settings to begin with, I think they would be 
> surprised at the amount of quality which remains... not to discount how much of their 
own 
> hard drive space will be saved. I know a 1MB WAV file with the high settings becomes 
just 
> 20kb in MP3 format with the lower settings. 
> 
> I visit another forum where the max file size for a single submission is 150kb. A person 
is 
> physically unable to upload any file larger than that. People have changed to the lower 
> settings in order to meet the file size restriction, and I can tell you that plenty of 
members 
> post, and plenty of others hear and understand their examples just fine. Hopefully some 
of 
> the members here will give the lower settings a try. :0)
> 
> Margaret
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@> wrote:
> 
> > You guys really do have to start using mp3 versions tho we are at 90% full again so its 
> going to come down to either some people wont be allowed to post files if they cant 
make 
> the transition, or all files will have to be deleted, or nobody will be able to post at all 
> because there will be no space left. 
> > 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>

>

Never miss a thing.   Make Yahoo your homepage.
